issue.title: AdGuard Cookie Notices filter is causing pizzafan.gr to be unusable

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

Filter version 2.0.25.64

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.pizzafan.gr/el

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. When a user visits the website, they cannot click anything on the website because a cookie notice blocks the user from doing so. AdGuard Cookie Notice filter blocks the cookie notice, but the blocking thing of that cookie notice is still left there. This prevents the user from accessing anything on the entire website, unless they disable uBlock Origin or the AdGuard Cookie Notice filter.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1: AdGuard Cookie Notice filter disabled. The cookie notice is showing up, and scrolling is blocked.</summary>

![Screenshot from 2023-10-01 17-10-18](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/123986260/7d5faebd-1302-45a5-a86e-028bed806d3f)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2: AdGuard Cookie Notice filter enabled. The cookie notice is not showing up, but the website is still blocked.</summary>

![Screenshot from 2023-10-01 17-06-58](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/123986260/76285e60-4e06-49ea-81a3-b4e7f0c46f20)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Fixed, update should be available in 2-3 hours.

comment.body:
> to me as a user, it is not transparent who maintains which filters

If you mean third-party filters, yeah, it might be confusing for the first time. However, most of them have a repo on gh.

> How would I file an issue for "Fanboy's Annoyances" on my own next time?

Like you mentioned before, using their forum. To be clear, it's one of the ways to report about the issue.
Actually, it's not necessary because they have [a gh repo](https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc).

> Thanks for your explanation and patience

You are welcome!:)

comment.body:
Dear @zloyden,

to me as a user, it is not transparent who maintains which filters. The screenshot with the filtered elements was my only clue to what might be going wrong. I saw no "Fanboy's Annoyances" in my log when I klicked the "Blocked" filter, therefore it did not occur to me to check that one. I should have filtered by "Modified" as well, which I missed to do. Thanks for your explanation and patience.

How would I file an issue for "Fanboy's Annoyances" on my own next time? Thanks for telling the maintainer on my behalf, though.
